Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I found out from my chemo during during my Herceptin infusion yesterday that last week my oncologist resigned without notice. I know that she had been having some personal issues over the last few years following a divorce but I never thought she would leave. This woman was one in a million. As an oncologist she was a specialist in advanced breast cancer and traveled the world studying. She was on top of her game. As a person, she was so compassionate and beautiful in every way. She even met my oldest daughter for coffee just to talk as my daughter has an enormous fear of doctors and she wanted to show her how doctors are just regular people. Seriously, what kind of oncologist does this for her patients. I am feeling a lot lost. The other oncologists at the cancer center are good but pale in comparison. This is heavy on my mind. I was supposed to have an appointment with her in June so I guess I will go and see what the other doctor is like but feel like I need to start searching for the best I can find. Jen Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: The Breakup (the grass isn't always greener on the other side) JeninMichigan tammie

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Have you ladies every looked at yourself in pictures, on TV or even in the mirror and said, "who the hell are you?"   Sometimes I don't even recognize the old me anymore.   This past weekend I was interviewed at the Race for the Cure and when I saw myself on TV, I was absolutely horrified.  YUCK!!!!    Hey, I know what is important and that is my health first.  I completely appreciate that so far I having a good run with treatment.   But gosh I used to be a pretty girl not all that long ago. Surgeries, Chemo, and menopause have taken it away from me.    I am pudgy (that is being generous) ... I am a good 30 pounds overweight and it is a speeding train I seem to have no control over.  My hair is just yuck.   Eyelashes and eyebrows grew in all funky.  Still don't have any fingernails to speak of.   My joints are all effed up that I look like I am 85 when I stand up.     This giant tire around my middle makes me sick.   Not to mention that I am sweaty too!!    To top it off, my cognitive function is pretty dull.   Maybe that sounds trivial and vain, but you know just because we are handed this crappy hand doesn't mean we don't want to still look attractive.   I am single and still have some lingering hope of having a man in my life but I can't stand myself these days I am not sure how someelse could find me attractive. That is my bitch of the day today!!!    Jennifer PS.  I will never ever agree to another TV interview or if I do, I don't ever want to watch it.   Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Who the heck are you? JeninMichigan SusanR

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: We have a division of our company that sells promotional products to promotional product distributors.   I just saw an email blast with big flashing pink letters ... "October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month" click here to see all of our pink products.    Of course, no money generated is being funneled to breast cancer nor does it claim that it will be.   It is just using this horrible disease to make money.   I want to express that I am offended by this but I seriously doubt that it will be well received.    If I had to guess, I think they would tell me as a supplier we are servicing those organizations who buy this product to sell in fundraising efforts to help the cause so we are actually helping the cause...   I don't rock the boat too much at work as I need this crappy job but still....   Am I just over sensitive as we approach Pinktober or do you find this equally offensive. Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer as a Sales Initiative JeninMichigan cookie97

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: After three weeks on Arimidex, I feel like poo.   My joints are a mess (that really isn't different than Tamoxifen) except my fingers were all swollen and very painful to bend.  I have been having pounding headaches and I rarely ever have headaches.  Went to go get a Herceptin treatment and my blood pressure was high.  it usually runs low about 110/65 and it was 147/95.    The nurse said probably why I have been having headaches.  I also was getting mouth sores here and there.  I called my oncologist and spoke to the nurse and said I was stopping Arimidex immediately.  I go see her on September 10 and am wondering what she is going to suggest.   I still am going to question her about how much bang I get for the side effects on hormonals.  I am <5% ER positive.   She took my ovaries and I was on Tamoxifen for over 3.5 years.    I hate the way they make me feel ... sort of fuzzy cognitively, bitchy, achy, sweaty and fat.   Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ditching the Arimidex ... JeninMichigan Heidihill

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: After being alone now for over seven years, I have finally found someone.   A few months ago I decided to try to start dating and even joined an internet dating service.  I went on two dates and freaked out and canceled the membership and decided it was more trouble than it was worth.  At Christmas I went to a gathering at a comedy club with about 40 people from high school.  Sat at a table with a guy from HS a year older than I.   He "Face-booked" me afterward and asked to get to know me better.   We have been talking non stop since then and in February I started seeing him.   It has been about every weekend since that time.   He knows about my disease and said he doesn't come with guarantees either.   We have been taking it sort of slow and with caution since I haven't had a real relationship since my divorce and certainly not since my diagnosis and I am careful with my daughters.   He and his daughter came out last night for a cookout and it was the first time the girls met.  They got along beautifully.   We are all going to a show today.  He is good looking, fun, caring, responsible, romantic and normal.  (if you knew about my ex you would know why normal is such as great thing) .   I feel so normal right now that it spooks me something bad will come and ruin it.      Just wanted to share it with you girls (and guys) Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Overwhelmed with sadness and anger at this **cking disease.   On Ash Wednesday I lost my long time friend and b/c mentor.  She was my hero.   A 14 year breast cancer survivor ... 5 1/2 years NED after mets to her liver.  This fall she reoccurred with lung mets.  Complications from Tykerb put her in the hospital with a ventilator over the holidays.   While they were trying to get her lungs in check, the cancer overtook her.  She left behind a 6 year old daughter and husband.  Gretchen was one of the purest, sweetest and most lovely women I have ever known. Today, another very dear friend with TN mets, was found this morning by her husband unresponsive.  They life flighted her and found two large tumors on her brain.  They are right now removing part of her skull to relieve the pressure.  She is extremely critical.   Cindy also is a beautiful woman who is a loving mother to twin girls.    Just now I read about Saint's additional mets to her liver.   Why???? Not to mention all the beautiful women we have lost ... so many with  young children. I just feel really really angry that this is happening around us and there is nothing we can do about it.   These are all good women and they have gone through and are going through hell.   It just wrong!!! Thanks for letting me vent some anger before I just explode. Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Katherine, you are such a supportive and vital part of our forum and full of knowledge.   From day one on the board, you stood out from the pack which is why I targeted you for my questions 1.     Can you tell us more about your personal life.. married/single, children or not, pets.   I know from your speech at the conference in Baltimore you are a twin.  Can you tell us about your family? 2.      Do you work full or part time?   If so, can you tell us about what you do (or did)?   Limitations imposed because of your disease or hurdles at work you have had to get over because of cancer.  Or if you no longer work, how do you fill the void?   3.      You are so knowledgeable about options and research.    How did acquire all this knowledge?  What are the best resources for someone to do some independent research? 4.      What is a typical day or week in the life of Katherine Obrien?    When you find yourself with "free" time, what do you like to do the most? 5.      Physically speaking, what are the overall top five most difficult issues you have living with MBC? She already has a lot of bone pain in her legs and doesn't feel like she would handle additional pain from the shot.  Thanks Ladies. Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Five years ago today I was diagnosed with what they thought was Stage II b/c.   A few tests later, they found the mets in my liver, bones and chest nodes.   I recall my surgeon telling me that I had a 8-12 percent chance of living 5 years.   This is EXACTLY why you don't listen to stats and survival rates.  Luckily my oncologist told me to disregard all those number and know that I will live a long time with a chronic disease.   So far, I have been blessed to have been NED for 4 1/2 years and my quality of life is very good.    My daughters were 12 and 8 at the time and I was so afraid of not being able to see them grow.  My oldest will graduate from high school this year and my youngest starts high school next year.    I thank God every day for blessing me with another year. Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I recently went in for a skin check.  And admittedly, I did it because a girl at work went and they froze off her birth mark and a dark spot on her face.  I had a dark spot on my face and have always hated it.   Well my mom had melanoma and my dad has had many many spots of Basel cell cancer removed so I also know i am high risk AND the fact I am a sun worshipper.   So I went and had the ugly brown spot removed (yay!!) but they found two suspicious moles they biopsied.  Well I got the call that one of them was abnormal and I had to get the margins all cleaned up.  So I went in today.  I was thinking that it would be a little more scrapping but instead they took out a pretty good sized chunk of tissue from my leg.  The doctor said that mole had a very high probability of turning into melanoma and he for sure wanted to get aggressive with the removal.  So now I sit with 8 stitches that I wasn't really prepped for today.   LOL ... I totally thought they would not even need to stitch me at all.    So after all that .. the point is ... check your bodies and moles.  Mine was a flat irregular shaped and very dark spot.  Not very big but appeared sort of out of the blue.   He said the correlation is very strong with B/C so it is important for us to be checked.  I know with all the appointments we have to go to and treatments who feels like going for a skin check.  I know i sure didn't and if it were for the vanity of getting that ugly liver spot removed on my face, I might still not have gone.   In fact, I nearly canceled the appointment today because WTH... I have stage IV b/c ... why bother.   I guess I am glad I went.   Yet another scar to add to my beautiful road map of them across my body!! Jennifer  Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Next Saturday my daughters and I are walking in the Komen Race for the Cure in Toledo, OH.  The race is being held in memory of one of my very dear friends who passed away in February this year.   I am part of a committee that we formed to create a fund in memory of Gretchen.  The fund is to support breast cancer patients who do not have support and childhood cancer .. two of Gretchen's long time causes she worked hard on.  For the race we had special t-shirts made for Team Gretchen and everyone is wearing their tshirt.  Of course, I received today my Pink Survivor Komen tshirt.   Which tshirt do I wear?  I am thinking for this race in memory of Gretchen I should wear the team shirt and not the pink survivor shirt?  Maybe a silly question but you ladies are always so smart... you'll help me not do the wrong thing. What do you think? Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Question - Race for the Cure Ettiquette JeninMichigan 3katz

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I have been on Tykerb since January - 1000 mg a day.   My oncologist added this with Herceptin and Aredia and I think I will be doing it for a year.     I started having issues with my fingertips splitting open which they still do.   Now though my nails are just peeling away on my fingers and toes.   I have had an ingrown toenail fixed and have another one that is infected right now.  I know this is the Tykerb.   I have absolutely no fingernails and had an infection in the skin around my finger nail too.     I am going to talk to my oncologist and see about maybe getting my dose descreased...but of course that worried me too.   I have been NED for a year now so I don't want to screw that up.  Anyone have these Tykerb issues too? Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tykerb causing me huge nail/finger issues JeninMichigan AusAla

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: As deemed by Alesta (lol).   Think I told you ladies I was invited to a 60th b-day party for my incredibly rich cousin.  It was up in Northern Michigan .. all expenses paid ... 3 days.   My somewhat new boyfriend and I and my sister and her husband drove up Friday night.    This was the first weekend away with the new man and he was a little nervous.    Well when we got up to our hotel room to change before the cocktail party Friday night it wasn't a hotel room but a beautiful two bedroom, two bathroom, kitchen, living room, deck suite overlooking Lake Michigan.   Took the stress off of having to share a bathroom, etc.   We went to the cocktail party and dinner ... it was so much fun.  My family is all 100 percent Italian and they party like there will be no tomorrow.    Saturday they picked us up in a chartered bus and we went to 8 wineries.    I am a certified wino so I was absolutely in heaven.    We met Madonna's dad at their winery which was kind of cool.    Took a little nap and then went out for dinner again and to a another bar for karaoke.   It was such a great weekend.   Lots of food, drinks and sex.    It was truly what the doctor should have ordered for me.   My man is wanting quite a bit from me in the way of future plans and it is really a damn shame I am in no position to talk about the future.  Not because I don't think he is totally Mr. Right but as you all know the future is a really hard thing to digest.  Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My Swanky Weekend JeninMichigan bobkat

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I was told to me by my (new) oncologist today.    I was dx in Feb. 2008 Stage IV from the start with liver, bone and chest node mets.  Her2 positive and weakly ER+.   I had a lumpectomy and six rounds of Taxotere, Carboplatin and Herceptin.   After three rounds in June 2008, I was NED .. everything resolved.  Finished chemo, did radiation, added Zometa, Taxomifen and then a year of Tykerb and continued Herceptin.   Eventually came off Zometa and have been on Herceptin ever since.   In July 2017, I stopped taking Herceptin after a consult at the University of Michigan.  They felt it was no longer necessary.   I stopped right there and then.  My cancer center in Toledo was only sort of on board.  My previous oncologist left and the new guy was pretty nervous about it but agreed with a pet scan in 6 month.   I am sure many of your know how hard it is to get insurance to pay for a PET scan and even worse if you are not in treatment.   After three months of arguing, my company is self insured and they overrode the insurance company and agreed to pay for it.   So now 9 months out of treatment, my pet scan came back clean.    I went into today to review the results and the oncologist said, "you know you are a miracle".   I said, "Yeah I begged and prayed to be one so I am pretty happy".   So we will pay attention to how I feel, get tumor markers drawn, visit every six months to check in but he doesn't feel like I need to have any more scans unless I psychologically need one or have symptoms.    We did talk about the emerging immunotherapy and how this could really make a difference.    He said I must have my own blend of immunotherapy in my biology.   I'll never feel totally at ease and free from this disease but today I am celebrating my reprieve.    I hope this gives some hope.   Jen Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I am a miracle?? Ok, I'll take that!! JeninMichigan Moderators

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: OK, I don't have a right to complain too much.  I am not on chemo right now... just Herceptin, Tamoxifen and Aredia.  This isn't the first time I have complained about getting fatter and fatter.  But now I am getting sweaty.    ugggh... WTH?     The hot flashes have been steadily increasing.  This week I got a huge zit on my face, bloated and terrible moods swings and then raging hot flashes.  it was like my body wanted to have a period and then took out its rage in hot flashes when it realized that wasn't going to happen.      The girls at my work told me to not worry about gaining weight and just be happy I am alive.   I told them that is not good enough.  It is like saying ... Oh now I have hair and I am just happy enough to have hair so I am not really going to try to make it look decent.     Are we wrong for wanting to still have some kind of attractiveness here?    Right now I just feel like a big, sweaty woman with a pimple and a really bad demeanor. Thanks for listening to me.   Jennifer  Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Big and Sweaty :-( JeninMichigan Fitztwins

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: My job has recently become so excessively stressful.  I work 12 hour + days and we are getting now the second set of wage reductions.  I have asked for help because I cannot keep the pace in addition to being a single mom and taking care of myself.   But there is no help available.  I am thinking seriously about inquring into SS disability.  I have worked for the last 27 years so I have good benefits built up.   How do you go about inquiring if you qualify?  Do you automatically qualify being stage IV or do I have to be more sickly than I am?    Assume you go on medicare when you are on permanent disability?    How does this affect your treatments?   I am just beginning to think about all this.    I have two daughters and I have been spending most of my waking minutes working or just doing the basics with them.   This is not how I want to live out the rest of my life especially not knowing really how much more time I get with them.  Thanks Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Social Security/Perm Disability - How do you go about it? JeninMichigan Brenda_R

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I have had my port out now for over 4 years and have been getting my Herceptin every three weeks (and occasionally Aredia) via an IV in my hand.    For the last year, we have been using my surgical arm with no issue due to the veins in my original hand getting scarred up.   So, typically we use my hand for the IV.  Yesterday, I had three attempts at my good hand and ended up putting it in crook of my arm (inside elbow) which worked fine.  However, the nurse said usually they like to save that vein for blood draws, scans, etc but since she had picked my three times already she was after a sure thing.    So, they suggest forearm on the underside.  I had an IV attempt there one time for a liver biopsy and it didn't work and was so painful.  Seems like the veins are deeper there.   Maybe I had a bad nurse too.   I have even had them eye up my neck ... YIKES!!!!! I do not want a port again.    I really really just don't.     What are your experiences with IVS other than your hand.    I am so grossed out by the whole thing.  I swear even through I have so many years of it, I hate it every time and get super nervous about it.   I am truly a big sissy about  needles.    Thanks!    Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: I am a miracle?? Ok, I'll take that!! JeninMichigan Moderators

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Just wondering if anyone out there might have a similar situation as I do.   I am a divorced mom of two girls.   My ex is a non participating parent.  He moved out of state and lives in a Winnebago in camp ground (year round .. he is in Ohio).   He owes me ALOT of child support.  Until recently, he worked under the table and so he did not pay any support.  He just got  a job working on highway bridges so they do take money out of his check now.  However, he has had a bench warrant for about a year.  We have been divorced for 4 years.  He has taken the girls twice overnight (about 3 yeras ago).  He sees them maybe one a month for a couple of hours.  My 14 year old will rarely ever go with him.   He is an alcoholic but I am pretty sure he has been sober for two years now (this is good).   He kinda went off the edge when we got divoced.. he got all kinds of really weird tatoos all over his arms (the devil praying, the devil laughing, half naked woman) and after I was dx he got his nipples pierced which really freaked me out.    Although he claims to be dead broke, he bought a brand new 1600 Kawaski Ninja crotch rocket with some decked out jacket, boots and helmet.   grrrr.  So, I am so afraid of what happens to my girls when I am gone.   My biggest fear and what I pray for the most is to be able to live until my youngest (10 years) is old enough to have a valid say in where she lives.   I am told in Michigan the courts favor biological parents for custody.   I have written a rather lengthy essay of my wishes.  I also put in my will to have my sister and her husband as my children's legal guardian... however I have been told it will not matter.   It will also not matter if he lives in a camper and is not financially able to take care of his kids and the fact that I KNOW neither girl will want to go with him.   He is nearly a stranger to them.   Just wondering if any of you ladies have this sort of situation going on?  What do you do?   I tried talking to him and he said, I will find a way to take care of my kids if I have to.  WTF??? Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Sex and Cancer JeninMichigan Bestbird

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I have been fighting some intestinal issues for the past two months that sort of starting coming on gradually and now are a problem.    Frequent stools and they are very soft and very small.   I am sick of going to the bathroom 10-12 times a day.    I don't have any abdominal pain but I always feel like I need to go.   The last 3-4 weeks I have had a huge amount of joint paint...mostly ankles and wrist and elbows.   So I start doing my own research and you know how dangerous that is.   I found colon cancer and crones disease.   I finally called my oncologist and told the nurse I just don't feel well and I feel like something is wrong.   The nurse mentioned getting a colonoscopy (yuck) but she is going to talk to my doc and see what she wants to do. I haven't had pet scan since January.  We were going to try to go a year but I don't  want to wait.   I also don't want to know if it is back either.    It is making me a little crazier than normal Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just asked My Onc for a scan .. I am concerned JeninMichigan meima-Bev

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Hi Ladies.  Just want to share some happy things.    First I have been on the South Beach diet now for over three weeks and I am happy to report I have lost 14 pounds!!   I have 10 more to go to get this "cancer" weight off me.   I feel really really good since this particular diet takes it off right around the belly area.  Second is that I have found the most wonderful man.   My mom has been friends with this man for many years as they worked on a political platform together.  He has wanted to meet me for several years.  Before my diagnosis but I was still trying to get over a divorce and he lives 800 miles away from me so I was not interested.   My mom stayed close all this time.  Sending him pictures and sharing my ups and downs. He was a very good friend and support system for my mom.  During my chemo he sent all kinds of gifts and just asked my mom to say they were from her which she did.   After I finished chemo and started to get better my mom continued to try to get me to meet him and I still said no.  A few months ago I caved and told her he could email me.   We hit it off immediately.   Then we started talking on the phone .. sometimes several times a day.   I have spoke to his father as well.   I was pretty skeptical about some man who lives so far away and why he would be so interested in me.  This past weekend he flew into town so we could meet in person.   He was every bit as wonderful in person.    I sent my kids to my parents for the weekend and had a whirlwind romantic weekend.    Breakfast, lunch dinner, dancing and talking to late in the night.   Amazingly, he finds me beautiful and desirable.    I would have never ever thought I would hear or feel those things again in my life.  In fact, I pretty much resigned myself to just taking care of my girls and to be happy with it.     We have plans to go out again in a few weeks and I am so excited.  I hope you don't mind me sharing this little bit of happiness with you all. Thanks Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Some Happy Stuff!!! JeninMichigan chrissyb

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: My HR manager received an email from the life insurance company a week or so ago saying they would send a copy of the approval letter in the mail to her.  She and I both took that as my benefits were approved and we were waiting on the check.   Friday afternoon I got a letter in the mail declining my benefits.   They said I do not qualify as terminal for the following reasons: 1.  All my Pet scans have all come back saying all areas of bone and liver metastasis where resolved and that I have remained NED 2.   My ECOG scores have been a 0 The said my doctor did not indicate I have a life expectancy of less than 12 months.  My doctor would only put +/- 12 months on my life expectancy and they agree with the findings that it is not less than 12 months.  My oncologoist is such an upbeat person and has been truly upbeat about my treatment all along.  This positive attitude is also conveyed in her patient notes.   I can see how the insurance company didn't see me as a lost cause.   I am beyond disappointed... I am mad.   I was really counting on this and I guess I should not have counted on it until the check was in hand.    I can appeal but I don't see the point. What makes me mad is that when I went to do get radiation following my chemo the local hospitals here would not give me radiation because of my stage. They said the risk wasn't worth the benefit and that my cancer was going to return anyway.   So at that time I was too terminal to get radiation and now I am not terminal enough to get my accelerated benefits. My HR said I could probably qualify for a draw from my 401K without penalty (but with taxes).    Jennifer  Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

So I called last week and asked to have my annual scheduled. I am looking at switching jobs and moving to a new company and really want the all clear and it has also been over 13 months. The nurse called me back and said my chart says Pet scans only as needed and why do I think I need one. While I don't beg for the extra radiation I do have metastatic breast cancer and had fairly extensive mets to my liver and bones. This is not my normal nurse so maybe that's the issue. She said she would ask my doctor but I felt a little dismissed this morning and it is bugging me. Jen Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I know this doesn't really relate to b/c but you ladies always provide such good suggestions and information.   My 12 year old daughter has been suffering from panic/anxiety attacks for the last 6 months.  I have taken her to counseling and to my naturalist but they have only mildly improved... still they are pretty disruptive to her life.  Her counselor last night told me that meds are really the last resort in his mind.   Of course, my naturalist was totally against it.  I took her to the pediatrician today and she prescribed Zoloft.  We had the talk about it increasing the risk of suicide and she told me that warning is really only for severely depressed children.  They were finding when they took it, it relieved enough of the depression that they were able to carry out the act of suicide they previously were too depressed to do.   She said my daughter does not at all fall into that category.   She feels that she has Generalized Anxiety Disorder and that taking the meds will allow her to have a normal 12 year old life.    I am scared to death to give it to her.   Any thoughts??? Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I have been NED now for over 2 years.   Haven't had a PET since January.  Onc says we will do them once a year unless I need peace of mind or my body is suggesting otherwise.   We never followed Tumor Markers until spring this year as she felt the scans were a better indicator.   So now we are doing 27/29s.   I come in usually 21 - 27 every month.   I called this week to check my last TMs test and it was 31.5.    I was like YIKES...its not going in the right direction.   My nurse said that my oncologist said I can have a PET if I am uneasy about the TMs.    I asked, "does she think I need a pet".  Her reply, "no, not really.  but she knows peace of mind is good for you".   She said it is still considered normal.    I tell her lets wait until next month. OK, so it is not a huge jump but I am totally unnerved about it.    I don't feel different....but now I am thinking gosh I have had not great intestinal issues the last few months.  Then it goes on .. do I feel more tired than usual.  Well hell yes, because now I am not sleeping because my stupid TMs took a little jump.   I swear I am nutcase sometimes.    I am also getting my port out on Friday because the catheter is killing my neck.    So I wonder... should I really be getting this port out.  Am I going to need it again soon for more than just Herceptin.   Somebody kick my butt back into reality please!!! Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How to Keep Your Head on Straight?? JeninMichigan 3katz

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: About 10 days ago, I experienced some crazy vertigo.   It happened when I was working out.  I bent over to do a burpee and the whole floor kind of went sideways on me.  Then I felt like I could feel my whole sinuses move around during push ups. I thought maybe I was having sinus issues so I called in to Tel-a-doc and got script for antibiotics.  I have been on them now for about 7 days and I still feel the vertigo and it has not improved.  When I lay flat on my back at night it is the worst and when I get up during the night I am not steady on my feet.  Also my left eye has been twitching off and on for a week.  Usually worse in the morning.   I am afraid to make the call to my doctor .. either primary or oncologist.    I have my annual C/T scan today and that is making me nervous enough.  I have been NED now for 8 1/2 years but being HER2 brain mets is always a fear.       I just started a new job at the beginning of the month, bought a new car too and don't want to even "go there" with this possibility.    I know I need to get checked but I really don't want to right now.   What are the chances this is just vertigo and not brain mets?  You guys are the first I have told about this besides my person trainer.  My fear factor right now is off the charts. WTF is that?   On the side where I had my lumpectomy and on the underside where the original tumor was located, I have this ugly rash.    it is darker purple spots scattered the whole area.   I don't think it was there before the shower because I remember looking at myself in the mirror and thinking again how fat I am getting and I would have noticed it.  I noticed it immediately when I got out     It doesn't hurt.   I am totally freaking out.  Could I have IBC and could it come on this quick.    I am getting ready for some huge meetings at work and my head is up my rear right now.     I couldn't post last night because my interest was slow so I took an Ativan and went to bed.  It is still there this morning :( Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Sudden Rash ... what is this? JeninMichigan apple

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Hi All.  I like to think I keep everything really under control but I think I am fooling myself.   I am a single mom, 2 daughters 16 & 12 (dead beat father),  working full time, living on a farm with no family near by and I also have stage IV breast cancer.      Luckily physically I feel not too awful and carry on pretty well with what I have to get done.  I have a very demanding job and my kid's lives are filled with activities.  Unfortunately my job is about 50 minutes away from home too.   So my 12 year old daughter has been having issues with anxiety attacks and panic attacks.   Now if I even look at her wrong or yell at her, she breaks down.    I took her to a counselor who said it started last year in fifth grade when her teacher would yell at her (first male teacher she had up until that point) and then again in middle school with a certain teacher in Math.   Also, times when I have been feeling poorly or irritable and yelling at her.     I am not harsh with my kids but I have come down on them for not pulling their weight at home and not helping me.    I want to move off the farm and they want to stay so I am pretty insistent they help.  Sorry this is all over the place.   What I am really asking is .... are there drugs any of you take on a regular basis to help keep your more even .. relaxed and not stressed out about the whole big picture.   I really hate to take another drug and so far have gotten away with only an occasionally ativan but I am thinking I am probably affecting my daughter's health and that has me feeling like dirt!! Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How to stay more even .. anxiety meds? JeninMichigan jenn3

Posts.Title: Brain MRI - Negative :-) JeninMichigan Leah_S

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Hello Everyone. Today I turn 50. My oldest turns 21 today also and my youngest is 17. Eight years ago, I was bald, sick from chemo and had mets to my liver, bones and chest. My "stretch" goal was to live to see 50 although at the time it was described as a "lofty" goal by many. I would not have believed at the time that I would have maintained NED for nearly 8 years. I would not have believed at 50 I would be in the best physical shape of my life and living a somewhat normal life Yeah, I wait for the shoe to drop still and I still get Herceptin every three weeks and my finances are damaged as well from cancer ... but in spite of it I am pretty darn good. My girls were 9 & 12 when I was diagnosed and I prayed so hard to see them to adults. Tomorrow my youngest and I are going to the Dominican Republic for a vacation and it will be a peaceful celebration for me. "Lofty" goals are possible!! Jen Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: This year our company went to a self funded plan.  They said very little about what this means except that they absorb the risk if we pay out more than we take in.   However, in researching it further, it sounds like our health insurance company - United Health Care - is merely an administrator and my employer makes the calls as to what gets covered and pays the claims.   If this is truly how it works, it makes me pretty nervous.  I just had my first claim denial.  My oncologist ordered a brain MRI and also an mri of the soft tissue of my neck.   They approved the brain mri and denied the neck mri.    Doesn't matter because I opted not to get either of them right now.   But I am wondering just who makes this decision and on what basis.   Seriously it is uncomfortable if it is my employer knowing all my medical issues and making the calls on what gets approved.  I am in a good place with my treatment just getting Herceptin and Aredia but as you all know that can change quickly.   Just looking for information so I am prepped when I talk to our new HR manager. Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Self Funded Group Insurance ..Do I need to worry JeninMichigan Fitztwins

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: A friend and co-worker was diagnosed this spring with Her2 and ER+ breast cancer - stage 2b.   She had a double mastectomy, chemo and just finished radiation.  She was looking forward to doing just herceptin for her 17 treatments.   She asked me last Friday if I ever had flashing green and yellow lights off to the side of my eyes.  I told her I had eye twitching and asked if she has had a brain MRI done.  Her primary told her it was probably due to her sinuses.   She called her oncologist on Monday he immediately ordered a brain MRI which showed all lobes of her brain covered in lesions.  The issues with her eyes have actually been seizures. They ordered 10 WBR treatments.  She has seen her oncolgoist today and he said the only thing they can do is the 10 radiation treatments but she has a very poor prognosis.  He advised her to go visiter her dad in Florida and get her affairs in order.   She isn't even sure she will go through the radiation at all.    Part of me wonders if they don't feel it is worth the investment trying to treat her.  She is in her early 50s and seeing a local oncologist.   She was pretty much given no opportuntity other than the radiation for any extension of life and they indicated the radiation will not really be enough to help.   This is the same group that refused to give me radiation after my lumpetomy because I was Stage IV.  They told me the benefit does outweigh the risk and that they were sure  my cancer was gong to come back anyway.    I don't know what to say to her.    I think if it were me I would be calling somewhere else in a frantic mess to live longer or at least try.   I feel like where she is getting treated is very conservative.   My heart is breaking for her and I desparately wish I could help. Jennifer </3 Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Brain mets present in 30% of Her2 patients.  Knowing this fact, I am sort of surprised that routine Brain MRIs are not part of my annual scans.   Not complaining though because I hate them for so many reasons but primarily because I am so claustrophobic.   I haven't had one for over two years but am getting one tomorrow following some chronic headaches for a month along with some pressure in my face and a bit of dizziness.  I really think it is a sinus thing which is why I went to my primary care doctor but she said I don't have a sinus infection.   I am tempted to cancel just because I really don't want to go. (stupid .. right??)   I am going but just wonder why it isn't part of the protocol anyway.   Last week I got scared and had my tumor markers drawn trying to get some reassurance.  They are up but still normal.  My doctor's nurse said as long as they float around normal I shouldn't worry.   (was 21 now 27).   Just wondering if you gals get routine brain MRIs.  I am thinking tomorrow is a double Ativan in the tube.   Jennifer Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: Well it has been almost three years since I have been on chemo but it still haunts my brain which used to be super sharp.  Today my oldest daughter had a track meet.   I unload the stuff from the car and we go to the field.  We had horrible storms and after a hour delay they finally cancelled the meet.  Went back to the car and guess who never shut her driver's door...me!!!!!  Either someone or the wind closed it slightly but not shut.  I drove home 45 minutes on a soaking wet seat.  Then I made my girls some dinner and they wanted to eat in the living room to watch the weather.   We eat and I go back into the kitchen to clean up and it is really warm in there.  I left the oven door open to cool down.   Well I never turned the oven off so it sat open set at 425 degrees for an hour.   I have to laugh but really ... it makes me frustrated and angry doing such stupid things. Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I still do not understand when our docs order our routine scans, why do they not include brain MRIs.   My oncologist said she scans in a heartbeat if there are symptoms but it still doesn't make logical sense to me.   I get a pet scan now just annually.  However, for Her2 positive b/c, one in every three are dx with brain mets.  So why wouldn't you be including a brain mri in the scans.  Why wait until there are symptoms and it may be too late or advanced to a less invasive procedure and then you are stuck with WBR.   I  just found out a friend of mine .. nearly identical age and pathology and location of mets.. just had a brain MRI due to some ocular flashing and it came back positive for brain mets.    Beyond just being so sad, it just makes me think again that the thought process seems lacking.    I am due for my annual pet at the end of this month which has me nervous enough.  Now I am wondering if I insist on a brain MRI too? Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: You learn something new every day.   I just found out what a Xiphoid Process is.  It is at the bottom of your sternum sort of where your last rib connects to the breast bone.  I have a round sort of lump there about the size of a quarter.   It doesn't hurt but is a little sensitive to touch.  Actually I have been touching it non stop so now I don't know if it would really hurt otherwise.   Of course, I am freaking out and researched it to death and it is a called Xiphoid Process.   Lots of people get fatty tumors on this "thing".    I am due for a breast MRI and am going to let it ride until June when I get my MRI but it is a little hard for it not to freak me out. Anyone else have any info on the Xiphoid Process or a lump there.   I use lump for lack of a better work... it is not a hard lump more of a soft kind of roundness that I can feel.    Good grief ... does the worry EVER stop???? Posts.Content: JeninMichigan wrote: I was scanning the net reading about side effects on Aromisin and came across a whole lot of info on AIs being used by bodybuilders especially just prior to comepetition.   It robs their body of estrogen so they can build mass.   I found it ironic that for the last two years I have been working out so hard 4 times a week and have steadily gained weight.  I don't have alot of fat but have ended up with some big hard thighs.   Is it related or maybe I just like to blame everything on the hormonal part of my treatment???   Interesting reading though.   Here we are stuck taking these dreaded pills to stay alive the bodybuilders take them to bulk up their muscle mass.  Lots of precautions as they warn how their joints can be dried and to only take them before competitions.    Hard on the joints ... ya think??   uggghhh  :-( Jennifer  Dx 2/22/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
